comments.body: I just noticed this is a public property whose value is a private type. How can clients actually use this property if the type is private?

Yeah, I poked around a bit at that.  It seems to work out by some sort of magic due to aligning typedefs.  I think we should make _GesturePolymorphicUpdateCallback a public type to simplify the story.  The whole class (_DragGestureRecognizer) is private, but I think these properties end up being public on a public class.  It's all a bit confusing.
"Signature" sounds like the description of a typedef rather than the description of a property; was this a cut and paste mistake?
(while you're here, I'm pretty sure "T extends dynamic" is the same as just saying "T" here.)
The class uses `+` on objects of type `T` and without `as dynamic` the analyzer gets sad.
ah right. if you're still around this code, can you add a comment to that effect? no big deal if you're not there any more.
